lines.text: The Ameriean Tobaceo Company
bood Menthe
o
Mr. T. C. Hays, Executive Vice President
R
LUCKY STRIKE Menthol 100's
We are submitting for Managcmont consideration and approval our recom-
ignated "LsL-Menthol" are being supplied along with analytical Labora-
tory data for the product.
Modcl LSL-Menthol cigarettes are constructed to be a full 10o mm in
length and dcliver 12-mg "tar" and 1.0-mg nicotine per cigarette. The
cigarette is 24.4 mm in circumference and contains a 27-mun filter, over-
wrapped with 32-nm tipping containing one row of perforations designed
to ventilate smoke delivery by approximately 30s.' The leaf blend and
casing are identical in formulation to LSA-62 (modified LUCky STRIKE Low
Tar Filter). Flavoring consists of a mcnthol formulation which has
been under development for some time and designed to impart menthol
taste characteristics similar to that of Newport menthol cigarettes.
Menthol delivery for LSL-Menthol cigarettes is targeted at O.o7 mg per
puff.
while no consumer testing has been conducted, wc fcel, based on Labora-
tory smoker evaluations and limited evaluations conducted by Charles and
Free among three Nowport smokers and one smoker each of Kool, Sterling,
Salem Iights and Bonson and lledges Lights menthol cigarettes, that model
LSL-Menthol delivers taste and flavor to be competitive in the markct-
place with major low "tar" menthol loo's products.
We consider Lsl-Menthol to be a mild, good-tasting cigarette with men-
thol taste and delivery midway between the Jight taste of Salem and heavy
taste of Kool. We reconmend LsI-Menthol as our candidate product for
test market introduction in Birmingham, Alabama, and two selected commis-
saries, with first shipments to the trade on August 5.
we have discussed this project with all concerned departmcnts and, with
timcly Management approval, are prepared to initiate tobacco prefabrica-
tion on Juiy ll, followed by cigarette production on July i5.
May we have your approval?
nwt

The Ameriean Tobaceo Company
bood Menthe
June 26, 1985
o
Mr. T. C. Hays, Executive Vice President
R
LUCKY STRIKE Menthol 100's
We are submitting for Managcmont consideration and approval our recom-
ignated "LsL-Menthol" are being supplied along with analytical Labora-
tory data for the product.
Modcl LSL-Menthol cigarettes are constructed to be a full 10o mm in
length and dcliver 12-mg "tar" and 1.0-mg nicotine per cigarette. The
cigarette is 24.4 mm in circumference and contains a 27-mun filter, over-
wrapped with 32-nm tipping containing one row of perforations designed
to ventilate smoke delivery by approximately 30s.' The leaf blend and
casing are identical in formulation to LSA-62 (modified LUCky STRIKE Low
Tar Filter). Flavoring consists of a mcnthol formulation which has
been under development for some time and designed to impart menthol
taste characteristics similar to that of Newport menthol cigarettes.
Menthol delivery for LSL-Menthol cigarettes is targeted at O.o7 mg per
puff.
while no consumer testing has been conducted, wc fcel, based on Labora-
tory smoker evaluations and limited evaluations conducted by Charles and
Free among three Nowport smokers and one smoker each of Kool, Sterling,
Salem Iights and Bonson and lledges Lights menthol cigarettes, that model
LSL-Menthol delivers taste and flavor to be competitive in the markct-
place with major low "tar" menthol loo's products.
We consider Lsl-Menthol to be a mild, good-tasting cigarette with men-
thol taste and delivery midway between the Jight taste of Salem and heavy
taste of Kool. We reconmend LsI-Menthol as our candidate product for
test market introduction in Birmingham, Alabama, and two selected commis-
saries, with first shipments to the trade on August 5.
we have discussed this project with all concerned departmcnts and, with
timcly Management approval, are prepared to initiate tobacco prefabrica-
tion on Juiy ll, followed by cigarette production on July i5.
May we have your approval?
